result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Jo Braaflat is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa Jo Braaflat was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (11/16/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.
Defendant to perform 30 hours uncompensated Community Service by 1/15/16 (to be monitored by TAD DPA). On or before 1/15/16, Defendant must file a form verifying that she has completed same.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 14CF290, 15CF150 No appearances. Court orders wage assigment.
Payment hearing on June 28, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Cases called 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 1:12 pm. Defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Adata Axelson and Jay Westhuis appears with TAD program.  Ms. Axelson is heard, requests full graduation.  1:26 pm, Yolanda Tienstra now appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Tienstra moves to dismiss with prejudice the TAD DPA.  Atty. Devitt is in agreement.  Court accepts Community service certificate on cases 14CF290 and 15CF150.  14CF267 - Court presents graduation certificate - case is dismissed with prejudice.

(10:36) 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 15CT75: Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is Sent. on 14CF267 (DPA) & 14CF290 and STC on 15CF150 & 15CT75; Amended Information filed in 15CF150; State heard - Joint recomm. on all and heard on same; Def. has valid DL; discussion held on other counts; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 1 Misd. BJ in 15CF150; Court finds plea in 15CF150 is made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Misd. BJ w/Count 2 dismissed; Court notes Counts 2, 3 & 4 in 14CF267 were to have been D&RI as of 1/9/15 plea hearing and so orders and 15CT75 is dismissed; State heard; Atty. Devitt heard; Court imposes sentence

14CF267: TAD DPA - no action, DPA cont. (Counts 2, 3 & 4 are D&RI as of 1/9/15)

14CF290: Misd. BJ - NC plea entered 1/9/15
 - 30 hours community service by 1/15/2016 (monitored by TAD DPA) - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge

15CT75; Dismissed

15CF150: Misd. BJ (dismiss Count 2)
- Additional 30 hours CS by 1/15/16 - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge
Sentencing hearing on September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:32. (14cf267/290). Defendant, Melissa Braaflat, in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Attorney James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended info filed in 14cf290.  Court reviews stipulation w/ attorneys.  Court reviews PQ/WOR; pnlts + chrgs; DPA.  Deft pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 14cf290.  Court finds plea made f/v/k/i, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.  Court dismisses Ct. 2 in 14cf290.  Deft pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 14cf267.  Court finds plea made f/v/k/i, accepts plea and places Deft on DPA.  Court ORDERS Defendant to comply with the program (to allow to bring back as contempt, not revocation).
Plea hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
for leave to file additional motions

14cF267, 290 Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't
14CF267, 290 Defendant, Melissa Braaflat in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court appoints Atty Mike Devitt, orders $500 down on 9/19, pay $50 every two weeks thereafter.

(12:46) Defendant Melissa Braaflat appeared by video means w/Atty Jaclyn Shelton (not eligible for SPD) . Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested wavint time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 cash  with conditions:  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
